snippet: As Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s third term draws to a close, his assertion of mayoral power has suffered a series of high-profile setbacks.
abstract: New York City Mayor Michael R Bloomberg has suffered a series of high-profile setbacks to his assertion of mayoral power, as his third term winds down, miring several of his marquee initiatives in litigation and raising questions about the wisdom of his administration's peremptory approach; adverse court rulings have become recurring impediment for a mayor accustomed to getting his way.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and DAVID W. CHEN

lead_paragraph: As Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s third term draws to a close, his assertion of mayoral power has suffered a series of high-profile setbacks.

headline.main: Courts Rein In Bloomberg’s Power to Make Policy
headline.print_headline: Courts Rein In Mayor’s Power To Make Policy
